      45             : /* This maps Fortran intrinsic math functions to external library or GCC
      46             :    builtin functions.  */
      47             : typedef struct GTY(()) gfc_intrinsic_map_t {
      48             :   /* The explicit enum is required to work around inadequacies in the
      49             :      garbage collection/gengtype parsing mechanism.  */

      51             :

     187             : /* Evaluate the arguments to an intrinsic function.  The value
     188             :    of NARGS may be less than the actual number of arguments in EXPR

     341             : /* This is needed because the gcc backend only implements
     342             :    FIX_TRUNC_EXPR, which is the same as INT() in Fortran.

     375             : {

     378         135 :   int argprec, resprec;
     379             : 
     380         135 :   argtype = TREE_TYPE (arg);
     381         135 :   argprec = TYPE_PRECISION (argtype);
     382         135 :   resprec = TYPE_PRECISION (restype);
     383             : 
     384             :   /* Depending on the type of the result, choose the int intrinsic
     385             :      (iround, available only as a builtin, therefore cannot use it for
     386             :      __float128), long int intrinsic (lround family) or long long
     387             :      intrinsic (llround).  We might also need to convert the result
     388             :      afterwards.  */
     389         258 :   if (resprec <= INT_TYPE_SIZE && argprec <= LONG_DOUBLE_TYPE_SIZE)

     391          26 :   else if (resprec <= LONG_TYPE_SIZE)
     392          22 :     fn = builtin_decl_for_precision (BUILT_IN_LROUND, argprec);
     393           0 :   else if (resprec <= LONG_LONG_TYPE_SIZE)
     394           0 :     fn = builtin_decl_for_precision (BUILT_IN_LLROUND, argprec);
     395             :   else
     396           0 :     gcc_unreachable ();
     397             : 
     398         135 :   return fold_convert (restype, build_call_expr_loc (input_location,

     400             : }

     402             : 
     403             : /* Convert a real to an integer using a specific rounding mode.
     404             :    Ideally we would just build the corresponding GENERIC node,
     405             :    however the RTL expander only actually supports FIX_TRUNC_EXPR.  */
     406             : 
     407             : static tree

     410             : {

     412             :     {

     415             : 
     416          16 :     case RND_CEIL:
     417          16 :       return build_fixbound_expr (pblock, arg, type, 1);
     418             : 
     419         135 :     case RND_ROUND:
     420         135 :       return build_round_expr (arg, type);
     421             : 
     422         882 :     case RND_TRUNC:

     424             : 
     425           0 :     default:
     426           0 :       gcc_unreachable ();
     427             :     }
     428             : }
     429             : 
     430             : 
     431             : /* Round a real value using the specified rounding mode.
     432             :    We use a temporary integer of that same kind size as the result.
     433             :    Values larger than those that can be represented by this kind are
     434             :    unchanged, as they will not be accurate enough to represent the
     435             :    rounding.
     436             :     huge = HUGE (KIND (a))
     437             :     aint (a) = ((a > huge) || (a < -huge)) ? a : (real)(int)a
     438             :    */
     439             : 
     440             : static void

    2209          90 :       tree rhs_token, rhs_offset, rhs_image_index;
    2210             : 
    2211             :       /* It guarantees memory consistency within the same segment.  */
    2212          90 :       tmp = gfc_build_string_const (strlen ("memory") + 1, "memory");
    2213          90 :       tmp = build5_loc (input_location, ASM_EXPR, void_type_node,
    2214             :                           gfc_build_string_const (1, ""), NULL_TREE, NULL_TREE,

    2279             : 
    2280             : 
    2281             : static void
    2282         624 : trans_this_image (gfc_se * se, gfc_expr *expr)
    2283             : {
    2284         624 :   stmtblock_t loop;
    2285         624 :   tree type, desc, dim_arg, cond, tmp, m, loop_var, exit_label, min_var,
    2286             :        lbound, ubound, extent, ml;
    2287         624 :   gfc_se argse;
    2288         624 :   int rank, corank;
    2289         624 :   gfc_expr *distance = expr->value.function.actual->next->next->expr;
    2290             : 
    2291         624 :   if (expr->value.function.actual->expr
    2292         624 :       && !gfc_is_coarray (expr->value.function.actual->expr))
    2293           1 :     distance = expr->value.function.actual->expr;
    2294             : 
    2295             :   /* The case -fcoarray=single is handled elsewhere.  */
    2296         624 :   gcc_assert (flag_coarray != GFC_FCOARRAY_SINGLE);
    2297             : 
    2298             :   /* Argument-free version: THIS_IMAGE().  */
    2299         624 :   if (distance || expr->value.function.actual->expr == NULL)
    2300             :     {
    2301         480 :       if (distance)
    2302             :         {
    2303           2 :           gfc_init_se (&argse, NULL);
    2304           2 :           gfc_conv_expr_val (&argse, distance);
    2305           2 :           gfc_add_block_to_block (&se->pre, &argse.pre);
    2306           2 :           gfc_add_block_to_block (&se->post, &argse.post);
    2307           2 :           tmp = fold_convert (integer_type_node, argse.expr);
    2308             :         }
    2309             :       else
    2310         478 :         tmp = integer_zero_node;
    2311         480 :       tmp = build_call_expr_loc (input_location, gfor_fndecl_caf_this_image, 1,
    2312             :                                  tmp);
    2313         480 :       se->expr = fold_convert (gfc_get_int_type (gfc_default_integer_kind),
    2314             :                                tmp);
    2315         484 :       return;
    2316             :     }
    2317             : 
    2318             :   /* Coarray-argument version: THIS_IMAGE(coarray [, dim]).  */
    2319             : 
    2320         144 :   type = gfc_get_int_type (gfc_default_integer_kind);
    2321         144 :   corank = gfc_get_corank (expr->value.function.actual->expr);
    2322         144 :   rank = expr->value.function.actual->expr->rank;
    2323             : 
    2324             :   /* Obtain the descriptor of the COARRAY.  */
    2325         144 :   gfc_init_se (&argse, NULL);
    2326         144 :   argse.want_coarray = 1;
    2327         144 :   gfc_conv_expr_descriptor (&argse, expr->value.function.actual->expr);
    2328         144 :   gfc_add_block_to_block (&se->pre, &argse.pre);
    2329         144 :   gfc_add_block_to_block (&se->post, &argse.post);
    2330         144 :   desc = argse.expr;
    2331             : 
    2332         144 :   if (se->ss)
    2333             :     {
    2334             :       /* Create an implicit second parameter from the loop variable.  */
    2335          28 :       gcc_assert (!expr->value.function.actual->next->expr);
    2336          28 :       gcc_assert (corank > 0);
    2337          28 :       gcc_assert (se->loop->dimen == 1);
    2338          28 :       gcc_assert (se->ss->info->expr == expr);
    2339             :

    2342             :                                  gfc_array_index_type, dim_arg,
    2343          56 :                                  build_int_cst (TREE_TYPE (dim_arg), 1));

    2348             :       /* Use the passed DIM= argument.  */

    2363             :                        &expr->where);
    2364             :         }

    2366             :         {
    2367           0 :           dim_arg = gfc_evaluate_now (dim_arg, &se->pre);
    2368           0 :           cond = fold_build2_loc (input_location, LT_EXPR, logical_type_node,
    2369             :                                   dim_arg,
    2370           0 :                                   build_int_cst (TREE_TYPE (dim_arg), 1));
    2371           0 :           tmp = gfc_rank_cst[GFC_TYPE_ARRAY_CORANK (TREE_TYPE (desc))];
    2372           0 :           tmp = fold_build2_loc (input_location, GT_EXPR, logical_type_node,
    2373             :                                  dim_arg, tmp);
    2374           0 :           cond = fold_build2_loc (input_location, TRUTH_ORIF_EXPR,
    2375             :                                   logical_type_node, cond, tmp);
    2376           0 :           gfc_trans_runtime_check (true, false, cond, &se->pre, &expr->where,
    2377             :                                    gfc_msg_fault);
    2378             :         }
    2379             :     }
    2380             : 
    2381             :   /* Used algorithm; cf. Fortran 2008, C.10. Note, due to the scalarizer,
    2382             :      one always has a dim_arg argument.
    2383             : 
    2384             :      m = this_image() - 1
    2385             :      if (corank == 1)
    2386             :        {
    2387             :          sub(1) = m + lcobound(corank)
    2388             :          return;
    2389             :        }
    2390             :      i = rank
    2391             :      min_var = min (rank + corank - 2, rank + dim_arg - 1)
    2392             :      for (;;)
    2393             :        {
    2394             :          extent = gfc_extent(i)
    2395             :          ml = m
    2396             :          m  = m/extent
    2397             :          if (i >= min_var)
    2398             :            goto exit_label
    2399             :          i++
    2400             :        }
    2401             :      exit_label:
    2402             :      sub(dim_arg) = (dim_arg < corank) ? ml - m*extent + lcobound(dim_arg)
    2403             :                                        : m + lcobound(corank)
    2404             :   */
    2405             : 
    2406             :   /* this_image () - 1.  */
    2407         144 :   tmp = build_call_expr_loc (input_location, gfor_fndecl_caf_this_image, 1,
    2408             :                              integer_zero_node);
    2409         144 :   tmp = fold_build2_loc (input_location, MINUS_EXPR, type,
    2410         144 :                          fold_convert (type, tmp), build_int_cst (type, 1));
    2411         144 :   if (corank == 1)
    2412             :     {
    2413             :       /* sub(1) = m + lcobound(corank).  */
    2414           4 :       lbound = gfc_conv_descriptor_lbound_get (desc,
    2415           4 :                         build_int_cst (TREE_TYPE (gfc_array_index_type),
    2416           4 :                                        corank+rank-1));
    2417           4 :       lbound = fold_convert (type, lbound);
    2418           4 :       tmp = fold_build2_loc (input_location, PLUS_EXPR, type, tmp, lbound);
    2419             : 
    2420           4 :       se->expr = tmp;
    2421           4 :       return;
    2422             :     }
    2423             : 
    2424         140 :   m = gfc_create_var (type, NULL);
    2425         140 :   ml = gfc_create_var (type, NULL);
    2426         140 :   loop_var = gfc_create_var (integer_type_node, NULL);
    2427         140 :   min_var = gfc_create_var (integer_type_node, NULL);
    2428             : 
    2429             :   /* m = this_image () - 1.  */
    2430         140 :   gfc_add_modify (&se->pre, m, tmp);
    2431             : 
    2432             :   /* min_var = min (rank + corank-2, rank + dim_arg - 1).  */
    2433         140 :   tmp = fold_build2_loc (input_location, PLUS_EXPR, integer_type_node,
    2434             :                          fold_convert (integer_type_node, dim_arg),
    2435         140 :                          build_int_cst (integer_type_node, rank - 1));
    2436         140 :   tmp = fold_build2_loc (input_location, MIN_EXPR, integer_type_node,
    2437         140 :                          build_int_cst (integer_type_node, rank + corank - 2),
    2438             :                          tmp);
    2439         140 :   gfc_add_modify (&se->pre, min_var, tmp);
    2440             : 
    2441             :   /* i = rank.  */
    2442         280 :   tmp = build_int_cst (integer_type_node, rank);
    2443         140 :   gfc_add_modify (&se->pre, loop_var, tmp);
    2444             : 
    2445         140 :   exit_label = gfc_build_label_decl (NULL_TREE);
    2446         140 :   TREE_USED (exit_label) = 1;
    2447             : 
    2448             :   /* Loop body.  */
    2449         140 :   gfc_init_block (&loop);
    2450             : 
    2451             :   /* ml = m.  */
    2452         140 :   gfc_add_modify (&loop, ml, m);
    2453             : 
    2454             :   /* extent = ...  */
    2455         140 :   lbound = gfc_conv_descriptor_lbound_get (desc, loop_var);
    2456         140 :   ubound = gfc_conv_descriptor_ubound_get (desc, loop_var);
    2457         140 :   extent = gfc_conv_array_extent_dim (lbound, ubound, NULL);
    2458         140 :   extent = fold_convert (type, extent);
    2459             : 
    2460             :   /* m = m/extent.  */
    2461         140 :   gfc_add_modify (&loop, m,
    2462             :                   fold_build2_loc (input_location, TRUNC_DIV_EXPR, type,
    2463             :                           m, extent));
    2464             : 
    2465             :   /* Exit condition:  if (i >= min_var) goto exit_label.  */
    2466         140 :   cond = fold_build2_loc (input_location, GE_EXPR, logical_type_node, loop_var,
    2467             :                   min_var);
    2468         140 :   tmp = build1_v (GOTO_EXPR, exit_label);
    2469         140 :   tmp = fold_build3_loc (input_location, COND_EXPR, void_type_node, cond, tmp,
    2470             :                          build_empty_stmt (input_location));
    2471         140 :   gfc_add_expr_to_block (&loop, tmp);
    2472             : 
    2473             :   /* Increment loop variable: i++.  */
    2474         140 :   gfc_add_modify (&loop, loop_var,
    2475             :                   fold_build2_loc (input_location, PLUS_EXPR, integer_type_node,
    2476             :                                    loop_var,
    2477         140 :                                    build_int_cst (integer_type_node, 1)));
    2478             : 
    2479             :   /* Making the loop... actually loop!  */
    2480         140 :   tmp = gfc_finish_block (&loop);
    2481         140 :   tmp = build1_v (LOOP_EXPR, tmp);
    2482         140 :   gfc_add_expr_to_block (&se->pre, tmp);
    2483             : 
    2484             :   /* The exit label.  */

    2486         140 :   gfc_add_expr_to_block (&se->pre, tmp);
    2487             : 
    2488             :   /*  sub(co_dim) = (co_dim < corank) ? ml - m*extent + lcobound(dim_arg)
    2489             :                                       : m + lcobound(corank) */
    2490             : 
    2491         280 :   cond = fold_build2_loc (input_location, LT_EXPR, logical_type_node, dim_arg,

    2588             : 
    2589             : static void
    2590         149 : trans_image_index (gfc_se * se, gfc_expr *expr)
    2591             : {
    2592         149 :   tree num_images, cond, coindex, type, lbound, ubound, desc, subdesc,
    2593             :        tmp, invalid_bound;
    2594         149 :   gfc_se argse, subse;
    2595         149 :   int rank, corank, codim;
    2596             : 
    2597         149 :   type = gfc_get_int_type (gfc_default_integer_kind);
    2598         149 :   corank = gfc_get_corank (expr->value.function.actual->expr);
    2599         149 :   rank = expr->value.function.actual->expr->rank;
    2600             : 
    2601             :   /* Obtain the descriptor of the COARRAY.  */
    2602         149 :   gfc_init_se (&argse, NULL);
    2603         149 :   argse.want_coarray = 1;
    2604         149 :   gfc_conv_expr_descriptor (&argse, expr->value.function.actual->expr);
    2605         149 :   gfc_add_block_to_block (&se->pre, &argse.pre);
    2606         149 :   gfc_add_block_to_block (&se->post, &argse.post);
    2607         149 :   desc = argse.expr;
    2608             : 
    2609             :   /* Obtain a handle to the SUB argument.  */
    2610         149 :   gfc_init_se (&subse, NULL);
    2611         149 :   gfc_conv_expr_descriptor (&subse, expr->value.function.actual->next->expr);
    2612         149 :   gfc_add_block_to_block (&se->pre, &subse.pre);
    2613         149 :   gfc_add_block_to_block (&se->post, &subse.post);
    2614         149 :   subdesc = build_fold_indirect_ref_loc (input_location,
    2615             :                         gfc_conv_descriptor_data_get (subse.expr));
    2616             : 
    2617             :   /* Fortran 2008 does not require that the values remain in the cobounds,
    2618             :      thus we need explicitly check this - and return 0 if they are exceeded.  */
    2619             : 
    2620         149 :   lbound = gfc_conv_descriptor_lbound_get (desc, gfc_rank_cst[rank+corank-1]);

    2625             : 
    2626         349 :   for (codim = corank + rank - 2; codim >= rank; codim--)
    2627             :     {

    2645             :   /* See Fortran 2008, C.10 for the following algorithm.  */
    2646             : 
    2647             :   /* coindex = sub(corank) - lcobound(n).  */

    2863             : 
    2864             :   /* 13.14.53: Result value for LBOUND
    2865             : 
    2866             :      Case (i): For an array section or for an array expression other than a
    2867             :                whole array or array structure component, LBOUND(ARRAY, DIM)
    2868             :                has the value 1.  For a whole array or array structure
    2869             :                component, LBOUND(ARRAY, DIM) has the value:
    2870             :                  (a) equal to the lower bound for subscript DIM of ARRAY if
    2871             :                      dimension DIM of ARRAY does not have extent zero
    2872             :                      or if ARRAY is an assumed-size array of rank DIM,
    2873             :               or (b) 1 otherwise.
    2874             : 
    2875             :      13.14.113: Result value for UBOUND
    2876             : 
    2877             :      Case (i): For an array section or for an array expression other than a
    2878             :                whole array or array structure component, UBOUND(ARRAY, DIM)
    2879             :                has the value equal to the number of elements in the given
    2880             :                dimension; otherwise, it has a value equal to the upper bound
    2881             :                for subscript DIM of ARRAY if dimension DIM of ARRAY does
    2882             :                not have size zero and has value zero if dimension DIM has
    2883             :                size zero.  */
    2884             :

    3210             : 
    3211             : 
    3212             : /* Remainder function MOD(A, P) = A - INT(A / P) * P
    3213             :                       MODULO(A, P) = A - FLOOR (A / P) * P
    3214             : 
    3215             :    The obvious algorithms above are numerically instable for large
    3216             :    arguments, hence these intrinsics are instead implemented via calls
    3217             :    to the fmod family of functions.  It is the responsibility of the
    3218             :    user to ensure that the second argument is non-zero.  */
    3219             : 
    3220             : static void
    3221        2495 : gfc_conv_intrinsic_mod (gfc_se * se, gfc_expr * expr, int modulo)
    3222             : {
    3223        2495 :   tree type;
    3224        2495 :   tree tmp;
    3225        2495 :   tree test;
    3226        2495 :   tree test2;
    3227        2495 :   tree fmod;
    3228        2495 :   tree zero;
    3229        2495 :   tree args[2];
    3230             : 
    3231        2495 :   gfc_conv_intrinsic_function_args (se, expr, args, 2);
    3232             : 
    3233        2495 :   switch (expr->ts.type)
    3234             :     {
    3235        2182 :     case BT_INTEGER:
    3236             :       /* Integer case is easy, we've got a builtin op.  */
    3237        2182 :       type = TREE_TYPE (args[0]);
    3238             : 
    3239        2182 :       if (modulo)

    3241             :                                    args[0], args[1]);
    3242             :       else
    3243        1754 :        se->expr = fold_build2_loc (input_location, TRUNC_MOD_EXPR, type,
    3244             :                                    args[0], args[1]);
    3245        2182 :       break;
    3246             : 
    3247         313 :     case BT_REAL:
    3248         313 :       fmod = NULL_TREE;
    3249             :       /* Check if we have a builtin fmod.  */
    3250         313 :       fmod = gfc_builtin_decl_for_float_kind (BUILT_IN_FMOD, expr->ts.kind);
    3251             : 
    3252             :       /* The builtin should always be available.  */
    3253         313 :       gcc_assert (fmod != NULL_TREE);
    3254             : 
    3255         313 :       tmp = build_addr (fmod);

    3257         313 :                                        TREE_TYPE (TREE_TYPE (fmod)),
    3258             :                                        tmp, 2, args);
    3259         313 :       if (modulo == 0)
    3260         313 :         return;

    3262          25 :       type = TREE_TYPE (args[0]);

    3264          25 :       args[0] = gfc_evaluate_now (args[0], &se->pre);
    3265          25 :       args[1] = gfc_evaluate_now (args[1], &se->pre);
    3266             : 
    3267             :       /* Definition:
    3268             :          modulo = arg - floor (arg/arg2) * arg2
    3269             : 
    3270             :          In order to calculate the result accurately, we use the fmod
    3271             :          function as follows.
    3272             : 
    3273             :          res = fmod (arg, arg2);
    3274             :          if (res)
    3275             :            {
    3276             :              if ((arg < 0) xor (arg2 < 0))
    3277             :                res += arg2;
    3278             :            }
    3279             :          else
    3280             :            res = copysign (0., arg2);
    3281             : 
    3282             :          => As two nested ternary exprs:
    3283             : 
    3284             :          res = res ? (((arg < 0) xor (arg2 < 0)) ? res + arg2 : res)
    3285             :                : copysign (0., arg2);
    3286             : 
    3287             :       */

    3339             : 
    3340             : /* DSHIFTL(I,J,S) = (I << S) | (J >> (BITSIZE(J) - S))
    3341             :    DSHIFTR(I,J,S) = (I << (BITSIZE(I) - S)) | (J >> S)
    3342             :    where the right shifts are logical (i.e. 0's are shifted in).
    3343             :    Because SHIFT_EXPR's want shifts strictly smaller than the integral
    3344             :    type width, we have to special-case both S == 0 and S == BITSIZE(J):
    3345             :      DSHIFTL(I,J,0) = I
    3346             :      DSHIFTL(I,J,BITSIZE) = J
    3347             :      DSHIFTR(I,J,0) = J
    3348             :      DSHIFTR(I,J,BITSIZE) = I.  */
    3349             : 
    3350             : static void
    3351          60 : gfc_conv_intrinsic_dshift (gfc_se * se, gfc_expr * expr, bool dshiftl)
    3352             : {
    3353          60 :   tree type, utype, stype, arg1, arg2, shift, res, left, right;

    3417             : 
    3418             : 
    3419             : /* SIGN(A, B) is absolute value of A times sign of B.
    3420             :    The real value versions use library functions to ensure the correct
    3421             :    handling of negative zero.  Integer case implemented as:
    3422             :    SIGN(A, B) = { tmp = (A ^ B) >> C; (A + tmp) ^ tmp }
    3423             :   */
    3424             : 
    3425             : static void
    3426         420 : gfc_conv_intrinsic_sign (gfc_se * se, gfc_expr * expr)

    3438         158 :       abs = gfc_builtin_decl_for_float_kind (BUILT_IN_FABS, expr->ts.kind);

    3440             :       /* We explicitly have to ignore the minus sign. We do so by using
    3441             :          result = (arg1 == 0) ? abs(arg0) : copysign(arg0, arg1).  */

    3467         262 :   args[0] = gfc_evaluate_now (args[0], &se->pre);
    3468             : 
    3469             :   /* Construct (A ^ B) >> 31, which generates a bit mask of all zeros if
    3470             :      the signs of A and B are the same, and of all ones if they differ.  */
    3471         262 :   tmp = fold_build2_loc (input_location, BIT_XOR_EXPR, type, args[0], args[1]);
    3472         262 :   tmp = fold_build2_loc (input_location, RSHIFT_EXPR, type, tmp,
    3473         262 :                          build_int_cst (type, TYPE_PRECISION (type) - 1));
    3474         262 :   tmp = gfc_evaluate_now (tmp, &se->pre);
    3475             : 
    3476             :   /* Construct (A + tmp) ^ tmp, which is A if tmp is zero, and -A if tmp]
    3477             :      is all ones (i.e. -1).  */
    3478         262 :   se->expr = fold_build2_loc (input_location, BIT_XOR_EXPR, type,
    3479             :                               fold_build2_loc (input_location, PLUS_EXPR,
    3480             :                                                type, args[0], tmp), tmp);

    3700             : 
    3701             :   /* Evaluate our arguments.  */

    3703             :     {

    3873             : 
    3874             : /* Get the minimum/maximum value of all the parameters.
    3875             :     minmax (a1, a2, a3, ...)
    3876             :     {
    3877             :       mvar = a1;
    3878             :       mvar = COMP (mvar, a2)
    3879             :       mvar = COMP (mvar, a3)
    3880             :       ...
    3881             :       return mvar;
    3882             :     }
    3883             :     Where COMP is MIN/MAX_EXPR for integral types or when we don't
    3884             :     care about NaNs, or IFN_FMIN/MAX when the target has support for
    3885             :     fast NaN-honouring min/max.  When neither holds expand a sequence
    3886             :     of explicit comparisons.  */
    3887             : 
    3888             : /* TODO: Mismatching types can occur when specific names are used.
    3889             :    These should be handled during resolution.  */
    3890             : static void
    3891        1186 : gfc_conv_intrinsic_minmax (gfc_se * se, gfc_expr * expr, enum tree_code op)
    3892             : {
    3893        1186 :   tree tmp;
    3894        1186 :   tree mvar;
    3895        1186 :   tree val;
    3896        1186 :   tree *args;
    3897        1186 :   tree type;
    3898        1186 :   gfc_actual_arglist *argexpr;
    3899        1186 :   unsigned int i, nargs;
    3900             : 
    3901        1186 :   nargs = gfc_intrinsic_argument_list_length (expr);
    3902        1186 :   args = XALLOCAVEC (tree, nargs);
    3903             : 
    3904        1186 :   gfc_conv_intrinsic_function_args (se, expr, args, nargs);
    3905        1186 :   type = gfc_typenode_for_spec (&expr->ts);
    3906             : 
    3907        1186 :   argexpr = expr->value.function.actual;
    3908        1186 :   if (TREE_TYPE (args[0]) != type)
    3909          18 :     args[0] = convert (type, args[0]);
    3910             :   /* Only evaluate the argument once.  */
    3911        1186 :   if (!VAR_P (args[0]) && !TREE_CONSTANT (args[0]))
    3912         280 :     args[0] = gfc_evaluate_now (args[0], &se->pre);
    3913             : 
    3914        1186 :   mvar = gfc_create_var (type, "M");
    3915        1186 :   gfc_add_modify (&se->pre, mvar, args[0]);
    3916             : 
    3917        2586 :   for (i = 1, argexpr = argexpr->next; i < nargs; i++, argexpr = argexpr->next)
    3918             :     {
    3919        1400 :       tree cond = NULL_TREE;
    3920        1400 :       val = args[i];
    3921             : 
    3922             :       /* Handle absent optional arguments by ignoring the comparison.  */
    3923        1400 :       if (argexpr->expr->expr_type == EXPR_VARIABLE
    3924         820 :           && argexpr->expr->symtree->n.sym->attr.optional

    3927          36 :           cond = fold_build2_loc (input_location,
    3928             :                                 NE_EXPR, logical_type_node,
    3929          36 :                                 TREE_OPERAND (val, 0),
    3930          72 :                         build_int_cst (TREE_TYPE (TREE_OPERAND (val, 0)), 0));
    3931             :         }
    3932        1364 :       else if (!VAR_P (val) && !TREE_CONSTANT (val))
    3933             :         /* Only evaluate the argument once.  */
    3934         538 :         val = gfc_evaluate_now (val, &se->pre);
    3935             : 
    3936        1400 :       tree calc;
    3937             :       /* For floating point types, the question is what MAX(a, NaN) or
    3938             :          MIN(a, NaN) should return (where "a" is a normal number).
    3939             :          There are valid usecase for returning either one, but the
    3940             :          Fortran standard doesn't specify which one should be chosen.
    3941             :          Also, there is no consensus among other tested compilers.  In
    3942             :          short, it's a mess.  So lets just do whatever is fastest.  */
    3943        1400 :       tree_code code = op == GT_EXPR ? MAX_EXPR : MIN_EXPR;
    3944        1400 :       calc = fold_build2_loc (input_location, code, type,
    3945             :                               convert (type, val), mvar);
    3946        1400 :       tmp = build2_v (MODIFY_EXPR, mvar, calc);
    3947             : 
    3948        1400 :       if (cond != NULL_TREE)
    3949          36 :         tmp = build3_v (COND_EXPR, cond, tmp,

    3951        1400 :       gfc_add_expr_to_block (&se->pre, tmp);
    3952             :     }
    3953        1186 :   se->expr = mvar;
    3954        1186 : }

    4104             : 
    4105             : /* ANY and ALL intrinsics. ANY->op == NE_EXPR, ALL->op == EQ_EXPR.
    4106             :    Implemented as
    4107             :     any(a)
    4108             :     {
    4109             :       forall (i=...)
    4110             :         if (a[i] != 0)
    4111             :           return 1
    4112             :       end forall
    4113             :       return 0
    4114             :     }
    4115             :     all(a)
    4116             :     {
    4117             :       forall (i=...)

    4120             :       end forall
    4121             :       return 1

    4558             : /* Inline implementation of the dot_product intrinsic. This function

    4560             : static void
    4561          97 : gfc_conv_intrinsic_dot_product (gfc_se * se, gfc_expr * expr)

    4571          97 :   gfc_se arrayse1, arrayse2;

    4656             : 
    4657             : 
    4658             : /* Emit code for minloc or maxloc intrinsic.  There are many different cases
    4659             :    we need to handle.  For performance reasons we sometimes create two
    4660             :    loops instead of one, where the second one is much simpler.
    4661             :    Examples for minloc intrinsic:
    4662             :    1) Result is an array, a call is generated
    4663             :    2) Array mask is used and NaNs need to be supported:
    4664             :       limit = Infinity;
    4665             :       pos = 0;
    4666             :       S = from;
    4667             :       while (S <= to) {
    4668             :         if (mask[S]) {
    4669             :           if (pos == 0) pos = S + (1 - from);
    4670             :           if (a[S] <= limit) { limit = a[S]; pos = S + (1 - from); goto lab1; }
    4671             :         }
    4672             :         S++;
    4673             :       }
    4674             :       goto lab2;
    4675             :       lab1:;
    4676             :       while (S <= to) {
    4677             :         if (mask[S]) if (a[S] < limit) { limit = a[S]; pos = S + (1 - from); }
    4678             :         S++;
    4679             :       }
    4680             :       lab2:;
    4681             :    3) NaNs need to be supported, but it is known at compile time or cheaply
    4682             :       at runtime whether array is nonempty or not:
    4683             :       limit = Infinity;
    4684             :       pos = 0;
    4685             :       S = from;
    4686             :       while (S <= to) {
    4687             :         if (a[S] <= limit) { limit = a[S]; pos = S + (1 - from); goto lab1; }
    4688             :         S++;
    4689             :       }
    4690             :       if (from <= to) pos = 1;
    4691             :       goto lab2;
    4692             :       lab1:;
    4693             :       while (S <= to) {
    4694             :         if (a[S] < limit) { limit = a[S]; pos = S + (1 - from); }
    4695             :         S++;
    4696             :       }
    4697             :       lab2:;
    4698             :    4) NaNs aren't supported, array mask is used:
    4699             :       limit = infinities_supported ? Infinity : huge (limit);
    4700             :       pos = 0;
    4701             :       S = from;
    4702             :       while (S <= to) {
    4703             :         if (mask[S]) { limit = a[S]; pos = S + (1 - from); goto lab1; }
    4704             :         S++;
    4705             :       }
    4706             :       goto lab2;
    4707             :       lab1:;
    4708             :       while (S <= to) {
    4709             :         if (mask[S]) if (a[S] < limit) { limit = a[S]; pos = S + (1 - from); }
    4710             :         S++;
    4711             :       }
    4712             :       lab2:;
    4713             :    5) Same without array mask:
    4714             :       limit = infinities_supported ? Infinity : huge (limit);
    4715             :       pos = (from <= to) ? 1 : 0;
    4716             :       S = from;
    4717             :       while (S <= to) {
    4718             :         if (a[S] < limit) { limit = a[S]; pos = S + (1 - from); }
    4719             :         S++;
    4720             :       }
    4721             :    For 3) and 5), if mask is scalar, this all goes into a conditional,
    4722             :    setting pos = 0; in the else branch.
    4723             : 
    4724             :    Since we now also support the BACK argument, instead of using
    4725             :    if (a[S] < limit), we now use
    4726             : 
    4727             :    if (back)
    4728             :      cond = a[S] <= limit;
    4729             :    else
    4730             :      cond = a[S] < limit;
    4731             :    if (cond) {
    4732             :      ....
    4733             : 
    4734             :      The optimizer is smart enough to move the condition out of the loop.
    4735             :      The are now marked as unlikely to for further speedup.  */
    4736             : 
    4737             : static void
    4738        7072 : gfc_conv_intrinsic_minmaxloc (gfc_se * se, gfc_expr * expr, enum tree_code op)
    4739             : {
    4740        7072 :   stmtblock_t body;
    4741        7072 :   stmtblock_t block;
    4742        7072 :   stmtblock_t ifblock;
    4743        7072 :   stmtblock_t elseblock;
    4744        7072 :   tree limit;
    4745        7072 :   tree type;
    4746        7072 :   tree tmp;
    4747        7072 :   tree cond;

    4750        7072 :   tree offset;

    4757        7072 :   gfc_ss *maskss;

    4812             : 
    4813             :   /* Walk the arguments.  */
    4814        4126 :   arrayss = gfc_walk_expr (arrayexpr);
    4815        4126 :   gcc_assert (arrayss != gfc_ss_terminator);
    4816             : 
    4817        4126 :   actual = actual->next->next;
    4818        4126 :   gcc_assert (actual);

    4820        4126 :   backexpr = actual->next->next->expr;
    4821        4126 :   nonempty = NULL;
    4822        4126 :   if (maskexpr && maskexpr->rank != 0)
    4823             :     {
    4824        1760 :       maskss = gfc_walk_expr (maskexpr);
    4825        1760 :       gcc_assert (maskss != gfc_ss_terminator);
    4826             :     }
    4827             :   else
    4828             :     {
    4829        2366 :       mpz_t asize;
    4830        2366 :       if (gfc_array_size (arrayexpr, &asize))
    4831             :         {
    4832        1618 :           nonempty = gfc_conv_mpz_to_tree (asize, gfc_index_integer_kind);
    4833        1618 :           mpz_clear (asize);
    4834        1618 :           nonempty = fold_build2_loc (input_location, GT_EXPR,
    4835             :                                       logical_type_node, nonempty,
    4836             :                                       gfc_index_zero_node);
    4837             :         }
    4838        2366 :       maskss = NULL;
    4839             :     }
    4840             : 
    4841        4126 :   limit = gfc_create_var (gfc_typenode_for_spec (&arrayexpr->ts), "limit");
    4842        4126 :   switch (arrayexpr->ts.type)
    4843             :     {
    4844        1523 :     case BT_REAL:
    4845        1523 :       tmp = gfc_build_inf_or_huge (TREE_TYPE (limit), arrayexpr->ts.kind);
    4846        1523 :       break;
    4847             : 
    4848        2603 :     case BT_INTEGER:
    4849        2603 :       n = gfc_validate_kind (arrayexpr->ts.type, arrayexpr->ts.kind, false);
    4850        2603 :       tmp = gfc_conv_mpz_to_tree (gfc_integer_kinds[n].huge,
    4851             :                                   arrayexpr->ts.kind);
    4852        2603 :       break;
    4853             : 
    4854           0 :     default:
    4855           0 :       gcc_unreachable ();
    4856             :     }
    4857             : 
    4858             :   /* We start with the most negative possible value for MAXLOC, and the most
    4859             :      positive possible value for MINLOC. The most negative possible value is
    4860             :      -HUGE for BT_REAL and (-HUGE - 1) for BT_INTEGER; the most positive
    4861             :      possible value is HUGE in both cases.  */
    4862        4126 :   if (op == GT_EXPR)
    4863        1860 :     tmp = fold_build1_loc (input_location, NEGATE_EXPR, TREE_TYPE (tmp), tmp);
    4864        4126 :   if (op == GT_EXPR && arrayexpr->ts.type == BT_INTEGER)
    4865        1206 :     tmp = fold_build2_loc (input_location, MINUS_EXPR, TREE_TYPE (tmp), tmp,
    4866        2412 :                            build_int_cst (TREE_TYPE (tmp), 1));
    4867             : 
    4868        4126 :   gfc_add_modify (&se->pre, limit, tmp);
    4869             : 
    4870             :   /* Initialize the scalarizer.  */
    4871        4126 :   gfc_init_loopinfo (&loop);
    4872        4126 :   gfc_add_ss_to_loop (&loop, arrayss);
    4873        4126 :   if (maskss)
    4874        1760 :     gfc_add_ss_to_loop (&loop, maskss);
    4875             : 
    4876             :   /* Initialize the loop.  */
    4877        4126 :   gfc_conv_ss_startstride (&loop);
    4878             : 
    4879             :   /* The code generated can have more than one loop in sequence (see the
    4880             :      comment at the function header).  This doesn't work well with the
    4881             :      scalarizer, which changes arrays' offset when the scalarization loops
    4882             :      are generated (see gfc_trans_preloop_setup).  Fortunately, {min,max}loc
    4883             :      are  currently inlined in the scalar case only (for which loop is of rank
    4884             :      one).  As there is no dependency to care about in that case, there is no
    4885             :      temporary, so that we can use the scalarizer temporary code to handle
    4886             :      multiple loops.  Thus, we set temp_dim here, we call gfc_mark_ss_chain_used
    4887             :      with flag=3 later, and we use gfc_trans_scalarized_loop_boundary even later
    4888             :      to restore offset.
    4889             :      TODO: this prevents inlining of rank > 0 minmaxloc calls, so this
    4890             :      should eventually go away.  We could either create two loops properly,
    4891             :      or find another way to save/restore the array offsets between the two
    4892             :      loops (without conflicting with temporary management), or use a single
    4893             :      loop minmaxloc implementation.  See PR 31067.  */
    4894        4126 :   loop.temp_dim = loop.dimen;
    4895        4126 :   gfc_conv_loop_setup (&loop, &expr->where);
    4896             : 
    4897        4126 :   gcc_assert (loop.dimen == 1);

    4902        4126 :   lab1 = NULL;

    5131        1760 :           tmp = gfc_finish_block (&block);

    5134             :                           build_empty_stmt (input_location));

    5137         875 :         tmp = gfc_finish_block (&block);
    5138        2635 :       gfc_add_expr_to_block (&body, tmp);
    5139             :       /* Avoid initializing loopvar[0] again, it should be left where
    5140             :          it finished by the first loop.  */
    5141        2635 :       loop.from[0] = loop.loopvar[0];
    5142             :     }
    5143             : 
    5144        4126 :   gfc_trans_scalarizing_loops (&loop, &body);
    5145             : 
    5146        4126 :   if (lab2)
    5147        2635 :     gfc_add_expr_to_block (&loop.pre, build1_v (LABEL_EXPR, lab2));
    5148             : 
    5149             :   /* For a scalar mask, enclose the loop in an if statement.  */
    5150        4126 :   if (maskexpr && maskss == NULL)
    5151             :     {
    5152        1332 :       gfc_init_se (&maskse, NULL);
    5153        1332 :       gfc_conv_expr_val (&maskse, maskexpr);
    5154        1332 :       gfc_init_block (&block);
    5155        1332 :       gfc_add_block_to_block (&block, &loop.pre);
    5156        1332 :       gfc_add_block_to_block (&block, &loop.post);
    5157        1332 :       tmp = gfc_finish_block (&block);
    5158             : 
    5159             :       /* For the else part of the scalar mask, just initialize
    5160             :          the pos variable the same way as above.  */
    5161             : 
    5162        1332 :       gfc_init_block (&elseblock);
    5163        1332 :       gfc_add_modify (&elseblock, pos, gfc_index_zero_node);
    5164        1332 :       elsetmp = gfc_finish_block (&elseblock);
    5165             : 
    5166        1332 :       tmp = build3_v (COND_EXPR, maskse.expr, tmp, elsetmp);
    5167        1332 :       gfc_add_expr_to_block (&block, tmp);
    5168        1332 :       gfc_add_block_to_block (&se->pre, &block);
    5169             :     }
    5170             :   else
    5171             :     {
    5172        2794 :       gfc_add_block_to_block (&se->pre, &loop.pre);
    5173        2794 :       gfc_add_block_to_block (&se->pre, &loop.post);
    5174             :     }
    5175        4126 :   gfc_cleanup_loop (&loop);
    5176             : 
    5177        4126 :   se->expr = convert (type, pos);
    5178             : }
    5179             : 
    5180             : /* Emit code for minval or maxval intrinsic.  There are many different cases
    5181             :    we need to handle.  For performance reasons we sometimes create two
    5182             :    loops instead of one, where the second one is much simpler.
    5183             :    Examples for minval intrinsic:
    5184             :    1) Result is an array, a call is generated
    5185             :    2) Array mask is used and NaNs need to be supported, rank 1:
    5186             :       limit = Infinity;
    5187             :       nonempty = false;
    5188             :       S = from;
    5189             :       while (S <= to) {
    5190             :         if (mask[S]) { nonempty = true; if (a[S] <= limit) goto lab; }
    5191             :         S++;
    5192             :       }
    5193             :       limit = nonempty ? NaN : huge (limit);
    5194             :       lab:
    5195             :       while (S <= to) { if(mask[S]) limit = min (a[S], limit); S++; }
    5196             :    3) NaNs need to be supported, but it is known at compile time or cheaply
    5197             :       at runtime whether array is nonempty or not, rank 1:
    5198             :       limit = Infinity;
    5199             :       S = from;
    5200             :       while (S <= to) { if (a[S] <= limit) goto lab; S++; }
    5201             :       limit = (from <= to) ? NaN : huge (limit);
    5202             :       lab:
    5203             :       while (S <= to) { limit = min (a[S], limit); S++; }
    5204             :    4) Array mask is used and NaNs need to be supported, rank > 1:
    5205             :       limit = Infinity;
    5206             :       nonempty = false;
    5207             :       fast = false;
    5208             :       S1 = from1;
    5209             :       while (S1 <= to1) {
    5210             :         S2 = from2;
    5211             :         while (S2 <= to2) {
    5212             :           if (mask[S1][S2]) {
    5213             :             if (fast) limit = min (a[S1][S2], limit);
    5214             :             else {
    5215             :               nonempty = true;
    5216             :               if (a[S1][S2] <= limit) {
    5217             :                 limit = a[S1][S2];
    5218             :                 fast = true;
    5219             :               }
    5220             :             }
    5221             :           }
    5222             :           S2++;
    5223             :         }
    5224             :         S1++;
    5225             :       }
    5226             :       if (!fast)
    5227             :         limit = nonempty ? NaN : huge (limit);
    5228             :    5) NaNs need to be supported, but it is known at compile time or cheaply
    5229             :       at runtime whether array is nonempty or not, rank > 1:
    5230             :       limit = Infinity;
    5231             :       fast = false;
    5232             :       S1 = from1;
    5233             :       while (S1 <= to1) {
    5234             :         S2 = from2;
    5235             :         while (S2 <= to2) {
    5236             :           if (fast) limit = min (a[S1][S2], limit);
    5237             :           else {
    5238             :             if (a[S1][S2] <= limit) {
    5239             :               limit = a[S1][S2];
    5240             :               fast = true;
    5241             :             }
    5242             :           }
    5243             :           S2++;
    5244             :         }
    5245             :         S1++;
    5246             :       }
    5247             :       if (!fast)
    5248             :         limit = (nonempty_array) ? NaN : huge (limit);
    5249             :    6) NaNs aren't supported, but infinities are.  Array mask is used:
    5250             :       limit = Infinity;
    5251             :       nonempty = false;
    5252             :       S = from;
    5253             :       while (S <= to) {
    5254             :         if (mask[S]) { nonempty = true; limit = min (a[S], limit); }
    5255             :         S++;
    5256             :       }
    5257             :       limit = nonempty ? limit : huge (limit);
    5258             :    7) Same without array mask:
    5259             :       limit = Infinity;
    5260             :       S = from;
    5261             :       while (S <= to) { limit = min (a[S], limit); S++; }
    5262             :       limit = (from <= to) ? limit : huge (limit);
    5263             :    8) Neither NaNs nor infinities are supported (-ffast-math or BT_INTEGER):
    5264             :       limit = huge (limit);
    5265             :       S = from;
    5266             :       while (S <= to) { limit = min (a[S], limit); S++); }
    5267             :       (or
    5268             :       while (S <= to) { if (mask[S]) limit = min (a[S], limit); S++; }
    5269             :       with array mask instead).
    5270             :    For 3), 5), 7) and 8), if mask is scalar, this all goes into a conditional,
    5271             :    setting limit = huge (limit); in the else branch.  */
    5272             : 
    5273             : static void
    5274        2248 : gfc_conv_intrinsic_minmaxval (gfc_se * se, gfc_expr * expr, enum tree_code op)
    5275             : {
    5276        2248 :   tree limit;
    5277        2248 :   tree type;
    5278        2248 :   tree tmp;
    5279        2248 :   tree ifbody;
    5280        2248 :   tree nonempty;
    5281        2248 :   tree nonempty_var;
    5282        2248 :   tree lab;
    5283        2248 :   tree fast;

    5414             :   /* The code generated can have more than one loop in sequence (see the
    5415             :      comment at the function header).  This doesn't work well with the
    5416             :      scalarizer, which changes arrays' offset when the scalarization loops
    5417             :      are generated (see gfc_trans_preloop_setup).  Fortunately, {min,max}val
    5418             :      are  currently inlined in the scalar case only.  As there is no dependency
    5419             :      to care about in that case, there is no temporary, so that we can use the
    5420             :      scalarizer temporary code to handle multiple loops.  Thus, we set temp_dim
    5421             :      here, we call gfc_mark_ss_chain_used with flag=3 later, and we use
    5422             :      gfc_trans_scalarized_loop_boundary even later to restore offset.
    5423             :      TODO: this prevents inlining of rank > 0 minmaxval calls, so this
    5424             :      should eventually go away.  We could either create two loops properly,
    5425             :      or find another way to save/restore the array offsets between the two
    5426             :      loops (without conflicting with temporary management), or use a single

    5799         255 : gfc_conv_intrinsic_shift (gfc_se * se, gfc_expr * expr, bool right_shift,
    5800             :                           bool arithmetic)
    5801             : {
    5802         255 :   tree args[2], type, num_bits, cond;
    5803             :

    5808         255 :   type = TREE_TYPE (args[0]);
    5809             : 
    5810         255 :   if (!arithmetic)
    5811         219 :     args[0] = fold_convert (unsigned_type_for (type), args[0]);
    5812             :   else
    5813          36 :     gcc_assert (right_shift);
    5814             : 
    5815         255 :   se->expr = fold_build2_loc (input_location,
    5816             :                               right_shift ? RSHIFT_EXPR : LSHIFT_EXPR,
    5817         255 :                               TREE_TYPE (args[0]), args[0], args[1]);
    5818             : 
    5819         255 :   if (!arithmetic)
    5820         219 :     se->expr = fold_convert (type, se->expr);
    5821             :

    5823             :      gcc requires a shift width < BIT_SIZE(I), so we have to catch this
    5824             :      special case.  */

    5826         255 :   cond = fold_build2_loc (input_location, GE_EXPR, logical_type_node,
    5827             :                           args[1], num_bits);

    5830         255 :                               build_int_cst (type, 0), se->expr);
    5831         255 : }

    5833             : /* ISHFT (I, SHIFT) = (abs (shift) >= BIT_SIZE (i))
    5834             :                         ? 0

    5863             : 
    5864             :   /* Right shift if negative.
    5865             :      We convert to an unsigned type because we want a logical shift.
    5866             :      The standard doesn't define the case of shifting negative
    5867             :      numbers, and we try to be compatible with other compilers, most
    5868             :      notably g77, here.  */

    5886             : 
    5887             : /* Circular shift.  AKA rotate or barrel shift.  */
    5888             : 
    5889             : static void
    5890         538 : gfc_conv_intrinsic_ishftc (gfc_se * se, gfc_expr * expr)
    5891             : {
    5892         538 :   tree *args;
    5893         538 :   tree type;
    5894         538 :   tree tmp;

    5896         538 :   tree rrot;
    5897         538 :   tree zero;
    5898         538 :   unsigned int num_args;
    5899             : 
    5900         538 :   num_args = gfc_intrinsic_argument_list_length (expr);
    5901         538 :   args = XALLOCAVEC (tree, num_args);
    5902             : 
    5903         538 :   gfc_conv_intrinsic_function_args (se, expr, args, num_args);
    5904             : 
    5905         538 :   if (num_args == 3)
    5906             :     {
    5907             :       /* Use a library function for the 3 parameter version.  */
    5908         496 :       tree int4type = gfc_get_int_type (4);
    5909             : 
    5910         496 :       type = TREE_TYPE (args[0]);
    5911             :       /* We convert the first argument to at least 4 bytes, and
    5912             :          convert back afterwards.  This removes the need for library
    5913             :          functions for all argument sizes, and function will be
    5914             :          aligned to at least 32 bits, so there's no loss.  */
    5915         496 :       if (expr->ts.kind < 4)
    5916         230 :         args[0] = convert (int4type, args[0]);
    5917             : 
    5918             :       /* Convert the SHIFT and SIZE args to INTEGER*4 otherwise we would
    5919             :          need loads of library  functions.  They cannot have values >
    5920             :          BIT_SIZE (I) so the conversion is safe.  */
    5921         496 :       args[1] = convert (int4type, args[1]);
    5922         496 :       args[2] = convert (int4type, args[2]);
    5923             : 
    5924         496 :       switch (expr->ts.kind)
    5925             :         {
    5926         372 :         case 1:
    5927         372 :         case 2:
    5928         372 :         case 4:
    5929         372 :           tmp = gfor_fndecl_math_ishftc4;
    5930         372 :           break;
    5931         124 :         case 8:
    5932         124 :           tmp = gfor_fndecl_math_ishftc8;
    5933         124 :           break;
    5934           0 :         case 16:
    5935           0 :           tmp = gfor_fndecl_math_ishftc16;
    5936           0 :           break;
    5937           0 :         default:
    5938           0 :           gcc_unreachable ();
    5939             :         }
    5940         496 :       se->expr = build_call_expr_loc (input_location,
    5941             :                                       tmp, 3, args[0], args[1], args[2]);

    5943             :          the first argument's width above.  */

    5945         230 :         se->expr = convert (type, se->expr);

    5947         496 :       return;
    5948             :     }
    5949          42 :   type = TREE_TYPE (args[0]);
    5950             : 
    5951             :   /* Evaluate arguments only once.  */

    5965             :                          zero);
    5966          42 :   rrot = fold_build3_loc (input_location, COND_EXPR, type, tmp, lrot, rrot);
    5967             : 
    5968             :   /* Do nothing if shift == 0.  */

    5970             :                          zero);

    5972             :                               rrot);
    5973             : }
    5974             : 
    5975             : 
    5976             : /* LEADZ (i) = (i == 0) ? BIT_SIZE (i)
    5977             :                         : __builtin_clz(i) - (BIT_SIZE('int') - BIT_SIZE(i))
    5978             : 
    5979             :    The conditional expression is necessary because the result of LEADZ(0)
    5980             :    is defined, but the result of __builtin_clz(0) is undefined for most
    5981             :    targets.
    5982             : 
    5983             :    For INTEGER kinds smaller than the C 'int' type, we have to subtract the
    5984             :    difference in bit size between the argument of LEADZ and the C int.  */
    5985             : 
    5986             : static void
    5987         270 : gfc_conv_intrinsic_leadz (gfc_se * se, gfc_expr * expr)
    5988             : {
    5989         270 :   tree arg;
    5990         270 :   tree arg_type;
    5991         270 :   tree cond;
    5992         270 :   tree result_type;
    5993         270 :   tree leadz;
    5994         270 :   tree bit_size;
    5995         270 :   tree tmp;
    5996         270 :   tree func;
    5997         270 :   int s, argsize;
    5998             : 
    5999         270 :   gfc_conv_intrinsic_function_args (se, expr, &arg, 1);
    6000         270 :   argsize = TYPE_PRECISION (TREE_TYPE (arg));
    6001             : 
    6002             :   /* Which variant of __builtin_clz* should we call?  */
    6003         270 :   if (argsize <= INT_TYPE_SIZE)
    6004             :     {
    6005         183 :       arg_type = unsigned_type_node;
    6006         366 :       func = builtin_decl_explicit (BUILT_IN_CLZ);
    6007             :     }
    6008          87 :   else if (argsize <= LONG_TYPE_SIZE)
    6009             :     {
    6010          57 :       arg_type = long_unsigned_type_node;
    6011         114 :       func = builtin_decl_explicit (BUILT_IN_CLZL);
    6012             :     }
    6013          30 :   else if (argsize <= LONG_LONG_TYPE_SIZE)
    6014             :     {
    6015           0 :       arg_type = long_long_unsigned_type_node;
    6016           0 :       func = builtin_decl_explicit (BUILT_IN_CLZLL);
    6017             :     }
    6018             :   else
    6019             :     {
    6020          30 :       gcc_assert (argsize == 2 * LONG_LONG_TYPE_SIZE);
    6021          30 :       arg_type = gfc_build_uint_type (argsize);
    6022          30 :       func = NULL_TREE;
    6023             :     }
    6024             : 
    6025             :   /* Convert the actual argument twice: first, to the unsigned type of the
    6026             :      same size; then, to the proper argument type for the built-in
    6027             :      function.  But the return type is of the default INTEGER kind.  */
    6028         270 :   arg = fold_convert (gfc_build_uint_type (argsize), arg);
    6029         270 :   arg = fold_convert (arg_type, arg);
    6030         270 :   arg = gfc_evaluate_now (arg, &se->pre);
    6031         270 :   result_type = gfc_get_int_type (gfc_default_integer_kind);
    6032             : 
    6033             :   /* Compute LEADZ for the case i .ne. 0.  */
    6034         270 :   if (func)
    6035             :     {
    6036         240 :       s = TYPE_PRECISION (arg_type) - argsize;
    6037         240 :       tmp = fold_convert (result_type,
    6038             :                           build_call_expr_loc (input_location, func,
    6039             :                                                1, arg));
    6040         480 :       leadz = fold_build2_loc (input_location, MINUS_EXPR, result_type,
    6041             :                                tmp, build_int_cst (result_type, s));
    6042             :     }
    6043             :   else
    6044             :     {
    6045             :       /* We end up here if the argument type is larger than 'long long'.
    6046             :          We generate this code:
    6047             : 
    6048             :             if (x & (ULL_MAX << ULL_SIZE) != 0)
    6049             :               return clzll ((unsigned long long) (x >> ULLSIZE));
    6050             :             else
    6051             :               return ULL_SIZE + clzll ((unsigned long long) x);
    6052             :          where ULL_MAX is the largest value that a ULL_MAX can hold
    6053             :          (0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF for a 64-bit long long type), and ULLSIZE
    6054             :          is the bit-size of the long long type (64 in this example).  */
    6055          30 :       tree ullsize, ullmax, tmp1, tmp2, btmp;
    6056             : 
    6057          60 :       ullsize = build_int_cst (result_type, LONG_LONG_TYPE_SIZE);
    6058          30 :       ullmax = fold_build1_loc (input_location, BIT_NOT_EXPR,
    6059             :                                 long_long_unsigned_type_node,
    6060             :                                 build_int_cst (long_long_unsigned_type_node,
    6061          30 :                                                0));
    6062             : 
    6063          30 :       cond = fold_build2_loc (input_location, LSHIFT_EXPR, arg_type,
    6064             :                               fold_convert (arg_type, ullmax), ullsize);
    6065          30 :       cond = fold_build2_loc (input_location, BIT_AND_EXPR, arg_type,
    6066             :                               arg, cond);
    6067          30 :       cond = fold_build2_loc (input_location, NE_EXPR, logical_type_node,
    6068          30 :                               cond, build_int_cst (arg_type, 0));
    6069             :

    6173             :

    6175             :                               fold_convert (arg_type, ullmax));

    6205             : 
    6206             : /* Using __builtin_popcount for POPCNT and __builtin_parity for POPPAR;
    6207             :    for types larger than "long long", we call the long long built-in for
    6208             :    the lower and higher bits and combine the result.  */
    6209             : 
    6210             : static void
    6211          60 : gfc_conv_intrinsic_popcnt_poppar (gfc_se * se, gfc_expr *expr, int parity)
    6212             : {
    6213          60 :   tree arg;
    6214          60 :   tree arg_type;
    6215          60 :   tree result_type;
    6216          60 :   tree func;
    6217          60 :   int argsize;
    6218             : 
    6219          60 :   gfc_conv_intrinsic_function_args (se, expr, &arg, 1);
    6220          60 :   argsize = TYPE_PRECISION (TREE_TYPE (arg));
    6221          60 :   result_type = gfc_get_int_type (gfc_default_integer_kind);
    6222             : 
    6223             :   /* Which variant of the builtin should we call?  */
    6224          60 :   if (argsize <= INT_TYPE_SIZE)
    6225             :     {
    6226          36 :       arg_type = unsigned_type_node;
    6227          72 :       func = builtin_decl_explicit (parity
    6228             :                                     ? BUILT_IN_PARITY
    6229             :                                     : BUILT_IN_POPCOUNT);
    6230             :     }
    6231          24 :   else if (argsize <= LONG_TYPE_SIZE)
    6232             :     {

    6234          24 :       func = builtin_decl_explicit (parity
    6235             :                                     ? BUILT_IN_PARITYL
    6236             :                                     : BUILT_IN_POPCOUNTL);
    6237             :     }
    6238          12 :   else if (argsize <= LONG_LONG_TYPE_SIZE)
    6239             :     {
    6240           0 :       arg_type = long_long_unsigned_type_node;
    6241           0 :       func = builtin_decl_explicit (parity
    6242             :                                     ? BUILT_IN_PARITYLL
    6243             :                                     : BUILT_IN_POPCOUNTLL);
    6244             :     }
    6245             :   else
    6246             :     {
    6247             :       /* Our argument type is larger than 'long long', which mean none
    6248             :          of the POPCOUNT builtins covers it.  We thus call the 'long long'
    6249             :          variant multiple times, and add the results.  */
    6250          12 :       tree utype, arg2, call1, call2;
    6251             : 
    6252             :       /* For now, we only cover the case where argsize is twice as large
    6253             :          as 'long long'.  */

    6255             : 
    6256          18 :       func = builtin_decl_explicit (parity
    6257             :                                     ? BUILT_IN_PARITYLL
    6258             :                                     : BUILT_IN_POPCOUNTLL);
    6259             : 
    6260             :       /* Convert it to an integer, and store into a variable.  */

    6262          12 :       arg = fold_convert (utype, arg);
    6263          12 :       arg = gfc_evaluate_now (arg, &se->pre);
    6264             : 
    6265             :       /* Call the builtin twice.  */
    6266          12 :       call1 = build_call_expr_loc (input_location, func, 1,
    6267             :                                    fold_convert (long_long_unsigned_type_node,

    6273             :                                    fold_convert (long_long_unsigned_type_node,
    6274             :                                                  arg2));
    6275             : 
    6276             :       /* Combine the results.  */

    6279             :                                     call1, call2);
    6280             :       else
    6281           6 :         se->expr = fold_build2_loc (input_location, PLUS_EXPR, result_type,
    6282             :                                     call1, call2);
    6283             : 
    6284          12 :       return;
    6285             :     }
    6286             : 
    6287             :   /* Convert the actual argument twice: first, to the unsigned type of the

    6296             : 
    6297             : 
    6298             : /* Process an intrinsic with unspecified argument-types that has an optional
    6299             :    argument (which could be of type character), e.g. EOSHIFT.  For those, we
    6300             :    need to append the string length of the optional argument if it is not
    6301             :    present and the type is really character.
    6302             :    primary specifies the position (starting at 1) of the non-optional argument
    6303             :    specifying the type and optional gives the position of the optional
    6304             :    argument in the arglist.  */

    6600             : 
    6601             : /* MASKL(n)  =  n == 0 ? 0 : (~0) << (BIT_SIZE - n)
    6602             :    MASKR(n)  =  n == BIT_SIZE ? ~0 : ~((~0) << n)  */
    6603             : 
    6604             : static void
    6605          60 : gfc_conv_intrinsic_mask (gfc_se * se, gfc_expr * expr, int left)
    6606             : {
    6607          60 :   tree arg, allones, type, utype, res, cond, bitsize;
    6608          60 :   int i;
    6609             : 
    6610          60 :   gfc_conv_intrinsic_function_args (se, expr, &arg, 1);
    6611          60 :   arg = gfc_evaluate_now (arg, &se->pre);
    6612             : 
    6613          60 :   type = gfc_get_int_type (expr->ts.kind);
    6614          60 :   utype = unsigned_type_for (type);
    6615             : 
    6616          60 :   i = gfc_validate_kind (BT_INTEGER, expr->ts.kind, false);
    6617         120 :   bitsize = build_int_cst (TREE_TYPE (arg), gfc_integer_kinds[i].bit_size);
    6618             : 
    6619          60 :   allones = fold_build1_loc (input_location, BIT_NOT_EXPR, utype,
    6620          60 :                              build_int_cst (utype, 0));
    6621             : 
    6622          60 :   if (left)
    6623             :     {
    6624             :       /* Left-justified mask.  */
    6625          30 :       res = fold_build2_loc (input_location, MINUS_EXPR, TREE_TYPE (arg),
    6626             :                              bitsize, arg);
    6627          30 :       res = fold_build2_loc (input_location, LSHIFT_EXPR, utype, allones,
    6628             :                              fold_convert (utype, res));
    6629             : 
    6630             :       /* Special case arg == 0, because SHIFT_EXPR wants a shift strictly
    6631             :          smaller than type width.  */
    6632          30 :       cond = fold_build2_loc (input_location, EQ_EXPR, logical_type_node, arg,
    6633          60 :                               build_int_cst (TREE_TYPE (arg), 0));
    6634          30 :       res = fold_build3_loc (input_location, COND_EXPR, utype, cond,
    6635          30 :                              build_int_cst (utype, 0), res);
    6636             :     }
    6637             :   else
    6638             :     {
    6639             :       /* Right-justified mask.  */
    6640          30 :       res = fold_build2_loc (input_location, LSHIFT_EXPR, utype, allones,
    6641             :                              fold_convert (utype, arg));
    6642          30 :       res = fold_build1_loc (input_location, BIT_NOT_EXPR, utype, res);
    6643             : 
    6644             :       /* Special case agr == bit_size, because SHIFT_EXPR wants a shift
    6645             :          strictly smaller than type width.  */

    6647             :                               arg, bitsize);

    6707             : 
    6708             : /* SPACING (s) is translated into
    6709             :     int e;
    6710             :     if (!isfinite (s))
    6711             :       res = NaN;
    6712             :     else if (s == 0)
    6713             :       res = tiny;
    6714             :     else
    6715             :     {
    6716             :       frexp (s, &e);
    6717             :       e = e - prec;
    6718             :       e = MAX_EXPR (e, emin);
    6719             :       res = scalbn (1., e);
    6720             :     }
    6721             :     return res;
    6722             : 
    6723             :  where prec is the precision of s, gfc_real_kinds[k].digits,
    6724             :        emin is min_exponent - 1, gfc_real_kinds[k].min_exponent - 1,
    6725             :    and tiny is tiny(s), gfc_real_kinds[k].tiny.  */
    6726             : 
    6727             : static void
    6728          90 : gfc_conv_intrinsic_spacing (gfc_se * se, gfc_expr * expr)
    6729             : {
    6730          90 :   tree arg, type, prec, emin, tiny, res, e;
    6731          90 :   tree cond, nan, tmp, frexp, scalbn;
    6732          90 :   int k;
    6733          90 :   stmtblock_t block;
    6734             : 
    6735          90 :   k = gfc_validate_kind (BT_REAL, expr->ts.kind, false);
    6736         180 :   prec = build_int_cst (integer_type_node, gfc_real_kinds[k].digits);
    6737         180 :   emin = build_int_cst (integer_type_node, gfc_real_kinds[k].min_exponent - 1);

    6739             :

    6741          90 :   scalbn = gfc_builtin_decl_for_float_kind (BUILT_IN_SCALBN, expr->ts.kind);

    6744          90 :   arg = gfc_evaluate_now (arg, &se->pre);
    6745             :

    6747          90 :   e = gfc_create_var (integer_type_node, NULL);
    6748          90 :   res = gfc_create_var (type, NULL);

    6765             : 
    6766             :   /* Finish by building the IF statement for value zero.  */

    6768          90 :                           build_real_from_int_cst (type, integer_zero_node));

    6770             :                   gfc_finish_block (&block));
    6771             : 
    6772             :   /* And deal with infinities and NaNs.  */
    6773         180 :   cond = build_call_expr_loc (input_location,

    6775             :                               1, arg);

    6778             : 
    6779          90 :   gfc_add_expr_to_block (&se->pre, tmp);
    6780          90 :   se->expr = res;
    6781          90 : }

    6783             : 
    6784             : /* RRSPACING (s) is translated into
    6785             :       int e;
    6786             :       real x;

    6788             :       if (isfinite (x))
    6789             :       {
    6790             :         if (x != 0)
    6791             :         {
    6792             :           frexp (s, &e);
    6793             :           x = scalbn (x, precision - e);
    6794             :         }

    6797             :         x = NaN;
    6798             :       return x;
    6799             : 
    6800             :  where precision is gfc_real_kinds[k].digits.  */

    7032             : static void
    7033         400 : gfc_conv_intrinsic_sizeof (gfc_se *se, gfc_expr *expr)

    7054             :     {

    7290             : 
    7291             : 
    7292             : /* Generate code for the TRANSFER intrinsic:
    7293             :         For scalar results:
    7294             :           DEST = TRANSFER (SOURCE, MOLD)
    7295             :         where:
    7296             :           typeof<DEST> = typeof<MOLD>
    7297             :         and:
    7298             :           MOLD is scalar.
    7299             : 
    7300             :         For array results:
    7301             :           DEST(1:N) = TRANSFER (SOURCE, MOLD[, SIZE])
    7302             :         where:
    7303             :           typeof<DEST> = typeof<MOLD>
    7304             :         and:
    7305             :           N = min (sizeof (SOURCE(:)), sizeof (DEST(:)),
    7306             :               sizeof (DEST(0) * SIZE).  */

    8175             : /* Generate code for REPEAT (STRING, NCOPIES) intrinsic function.  */
    8176             : 
    8177             : static void
    8178         477 : gfc_conv_intrinsic_repeat (gfc_se * se, gfc_expr * expr)
    8179             : {
    8180         477 :   tree args[3], ncopies, dest, dlen, src, slen, ncopies_type;

    8182         477 :   tree size;

    8184         477 :   int i;
    8185             : 
    8186             :   /* We store in charsize the size of a character.  */

    8188         954 :   size = build_int_cst (sizetype, gfc_character_kinds[i].bit_size / 8);
    8189             : 
    8190             :   /* Get the arguments.  */

    8192         477 :   slen = fold_convert (sizetype, gfc_evaluate_now (args[0], &se->pre));
    8193         477 :   src = args[1];
    8194         477 :   ncopies = gfc_evaluate_now (args[2], &se->pre);
    8195         477 :   ncopies_type = TREE_TYPE (ncopies);
    8196             : 
    8197             :   /* Check that NCOPIES is not negative.  */
    8198         477 :   cond = fold_build2_loc (input_location, LT_EXPR, logical_type_node, ncopies,
    8199         477 :                           build_int_cst (ncopies_type, 0));
    8200         477 :   gfc_trans_runtime_check (true, false, cond, &se->pre, &expr->where,
    8201             :                            "Argument NCOPIES of REPEAT intrinsic is negative "
    8202             :                            "(its value is %ld)",
    8203             :                            fold_convert (long_integer_type_node, ncopies));
    8204             : 
    8205             :   /* If the source length is zero, any non negative value of NCOPIES
    8206             :      is valid, and nothing happens.  */

    8209             :                           size_zero_node);

    8211         477 :                          build_int_cst (ncopies_type, 0), ncopies);
    8212         477 :   gfc_add_modify (&se->pre, n, tmp);
    8213         477 :   ncopies = n;
    8214             : 
    8215             :   /* Check that ncopies is not too large: ncopies should be less than
    8216             :      (or equal to) MAX / slen, where MAX is the maximal integer of
    8217             :      the gfc_charlen_type_node type.  If slen == 0, we need a special
    8218             :      case to avoid the division by zero.  */

    8220         477 :                          fold_convert (sizetype,

    8229             :                          size_zero_node);

    8231             :                           logical_false_node, cond);

    8238             :                           fold_convert (gfc_charlen_type_node, ncopies));

    8240         477 :   dest = gfc_conv_string_tmp (se, build_pointer_type (type), dlen);

    8242             :   /* Generate the code to do the repeat operation:
    8243             :        for (i = 0; i < ncopies; i++)
    8244             :          memmove (dest + (i * slen * size), src, slen*size);  */

    8246         477 :   count = gfc_create_var (sizetype, "count");

    8250             :   /* Start the loop body.  */

    8252             :

    8255             :                           fold_convert (sizetype, ncopies));

    8262             :   /* Call memmove (dest + (i*slen*size), src, slen*size).  */

    8273             :                                               size_type_node, slen, size));
    8274         477 :   gfc_add_expr_to_block (&body, tmp);
    8275             : 
    8276             :   /* Increment count.  */

    8278             :                          count, size_one_node);
    8279         477 :   gfc_add_modify (&body, count, tmp);

    8283         477 :   gfc_add_expr_to_block (&block, tmp);
    8284             : 
    8285             :   /* Add the exit label.  */
    8286         477 :   tmp = build1_v (LABEL_EXPR, exit_label);
    8287         477 :   gfc_add_expr_to_block (&block, tmp);
    8288             : 
    8289             :   /* Finish the block.  */
    8290         477 :   tmp = gfc_finish_block (&block);

    8293             :   /* Set the result value.  */
    8294         477 :   se->expr = dest;

    8791             : 
    8792             :   /* Make the function call.  */
    8793         240 :   call = build_call_expr_loc (input_location, decl, 1, arg);
    8794         240 :   se->expr = fold_convert (gfc_typenode_for_spec (&expr->ts), call);
    8795             : 
    8796             :   /* Restore floating-point state.  */
    8797         240 :   gfc_restore_fp_state (&se->post, fpstate);
    8798         240 : }

    8813          84 :       > TYPE_PRECISION (TREE_TYPE (args[1])))

    8987             : 
    8988             : /* Generate code for an intrinsic function.  Some map directly to library
    8989             :    calls, others get special handling.  In some cases the name of the function
    8990             :    used depends on the type specifiers.  */
    8991             : 
    8992             : void
    8993      145861 : gfc_conv_intrinsic_function (gfc_se * se, gfc_expr * expr)
