    9667             : 
    9668             : 
    9669             : static gfc_ss *
    9670        1275 : walk_inline_intrinsic_transpose (gfc_ss *ss, gfc_expr *expr)
    9671             : {
    9672        1275 :   gfc_ss *arg_ss, *tmp_ss;
    9673        1275 :   gfc_actual_arglist *arg;
    9674             : 
    9675        1275 :   arg = expr->value.function.actual;
    9676             : 
    9677        1275 :   gcc_assert (arg->expr);
    9678             : 
    9679        1275 :   arg_ss = gfc_walk_subexpr (gfc_ss_terminator, arg->expr);
    9680        1275 :   gcc_assert (arg_ss != gfc_ss_terminator);
    9681             : 
    9682             :   for (tmp_ss = arg_ss; ; tmp_ss = tmp_ss->next)
    9683             :     {
    9684        1380 :       if (tmp_ss->info->type != GFC_SS_SCALAR
    9685             :           && tmp_ss->info->type != GFC_SS_REFERENCE)
    9686             :         {
    9687        1343 :           gcc_assert (tmp_ss->dimen == 2);
    9688             : 
    9689             :           /* We just invert dimensions.  */
    9690        1343 :           std::swap (tmp_ss->dim[0], tmp_ss->dim[1]);
    9691             :         }
    9692             : 
    9693             :       /* Stop when tmp_ss points to the last valid element of the chain...  */
    9694        1380 :       if (tmp_ss->next == gfc_ss_terminator)
    9695             :         break;
    9696             :     }
    9697             : 
    9698             :   /* ... so that we can attach the rest of the chain to it.  */
    9699        1275 :   tmp_ss->next = ss;
    9700             : 
    9701        1275 :   return arg_ss;
    9702             : }
    9703             : 
    9704             : 
    9705             : /* Move the given dimension of the given gfc_ss list to a nested gfc_ss list.
    9706             :    This has the side effect of reversing the nested list, so there is no
    9707             :    need to call gfc_reverse_ss on it (the given list is assumed not to be
    9708             :    reversed yet).   */
    9709             : 
    9710             : static gfc_ss *
    9711         565 : nest_loop_dimension (gfc_ss *ss, int dim)
    9712             : {
    9713         565 :   int ss_dim, i;
    9714         565 :   gfc_ss *new_ss, *prev_ss = gfc_ss_terminator;
    9715         565 :   gfc_loopinfo *new_loop;
    9716             : 
    9717         565 :   gcc_assert (ss != gfc_ss_terminator);
    9718             : 
    9719        1319 :   for (; ss != gfc_ss_terminator; ss = ss->next)
    9720             :     {
    9721         754 :       new_ss = gfc_get_ss ();
    9722         754 :       new_ss->next = prev_ss;
    9723         754 :       new_ss->parent = ss;
    9724         754 :       new_ss->info = ss->info;
    9725         754 :       new_ss->info->refcount++;
    9726         754 :       if (ss->dimen != 0)
    9727             :         {
    9728         695 :           gcc_assert (ss->info->type != GFC_SS_SCALAR
    9729             :                       && ss->info->type != GFC_SS_REFERENCE);
    9730             : 
    9731         695 :           new_ss->dimen = 1;
    9732         695 :           new_ss->dim[0] = ss->dim[dim];
    9733             : 
    9734         695 :           gcc_assert (dim < ss->dimen);
    9735             : 
    9736         695 :           ss_dim = --ss->dimen;
    9737        1173 :           for (i = dim; i < ss_dim; i++)
    9738         478 :             ss->dim[i] = ss->dim[i + 1];
    9739             : 
    9740         695 :           ss->dim[ss_dim] = 0;
    9741             :         }
    9742         754 :       prev_ss = new_ss;
    9743             : 
    9744         754 :       if (ss->nested_ss)
    9745             :         {
    9746          81 :           ss->nested_ss->parent = new_ss;
    9747          81 :           new_ss->nested_ss = ss->nested_ss;
    9748             :         }
    9749         754 :       ss->nested_ss = new_ss;
    9750             :     }
    9751             : 
    9752         565 :   new_loop = gfc_get_loopinfo ();
    9753         565 :   gfc_init_loopinfo (new_loop);
    9754             :

   11050             : tree
   11051        5073 : gfc_conv_intrinsic_subroutine (gfc_code *code)
   11052             : {
   11053        5073 :   tree res;
   11054             : 
   11055        5073 :   gcc_assert (code->resolved_isym);
   11056             : 
   11057        5073 :   switch (code->resolved_isym->id)
   11058             :     {
   11059         206 :     case GFC_ISYM_MOVE_ALLOC:
   11060         206 :       res = conv_intrinsic_move_alloc (code);
   11061         206 :       break;
   11062             : 
   11063          10 :     case GFC_ISYM_ATOMIC_CAS:
   11064          10 :       res = conv_intrinsic_atomic_cas (code);
   11065          10 :       break;
   11066             : 
   11067          68 :     case GFC_ISYM_ATOMIC_ADD:
   11068          68 :     case GFC_ISYM_ATOMIC_AND:
